page.title: 10ECONOMICS IN BALFRON AREA
page.content: In the{Bank}there are 18 people employed, 10 men and 8 women. The bank staff work even when the bank is closed in the morning before 9.30am and after 3.30pm. On average the bank has{1000 customers}each week, but they deal with less customers since they put the "Auto-teller" outside. There are 400 children in the village who are keen to save their money and join the{Supersavers Club. The building in Cotton Street is the main bank for the area and there are branches in the villages round about. Similarly, the{Post Office}serves the area and all the mail is "sorted" in a special "sorting house" behind the Post Office. Pensions are paid at the Post Office and some people keep their money in the Post Office Savings Bank.
